attributes.action: make it illegal to design cars in such a way that drivers are unable to see pedestrians who are under a specific height
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I recently read a case in my paper in which a driver basically got away with killing a pedestrian because "the high rear window of his car made it hard for him to see the 5ft 4in pedestrian". I reluctantly accept that this decision was probably fair but why was he driving such a car in the first place and why is it, presumably, legal for such cars to be built?  I am particularly concerned because I myself am just under 5ft; in any case surely the safety of pedestrians - of whatever height - should greatly, and UNQUESTIONINGLY, supersede the "right" of drivers to possess and drive such cars.
